column4: Very big and beautiful older church. A lot of detail, pretty Windows, and religious artifacts. I love to check these old churches out.
Attend a mass, or just pop in to see the amazing architecture. 'Feel' the peace. Spend a few minutes or sit and have some alone time. Beautiful!
Very nice Basilica . We went on Mass on Sunday. Very oldBasilica with lots of charm.The paintings are very nice.

I am simply amazed with the architecture every time I step into this beautiful church. One truly feels the need to speak in hushed whispers in respect and reverence to the surroundings. From the beauty and majesty of the soaring ceilings to the grace of the stained glass, you are invited to just Be.
Even if you are not a spiritual person, you cannot help but feel something, anything, when here. This is a must see when on the Island.

As a photographer St. Dunstan's Basilica is a remarkable building. From the outside, every crook and cranny has interest. The stones and carvings are intricate and beautiful, each telling a story of time and weathering history. Once you enter the doors you are swept away by the scents, sounds and sights from floor to ceilings to walls and windows. The...
Amazed architecture with such a large edifice. I absolutely loved walking around in it.It was spacious to say the least.

After visiting several amazing European cathedrals, it was interesting to see St. Dunstan's as it is a lovely, scaled down version. We did not tour too deeply as there were prayers we did not want to disturb but I would certainly recommend doing so when the schedule permits.

This basilica is located on the walking town for the town. It is very nice old church. Maintenance and beautiful. KOne item of interest was the sigh said that cell phones were not permitted as were in-line skates!

Every time I bring someone to Charlottetown I cannot avoid a visit to the Basilica. It is an amazing structure full of history in one of the most historic neighbourhoods in Canada. Great George Street has beautiful rustic lantern style Street lamps with beautiful hanging flower baskets leading to the legislative building where PEI received its name the cradle of...

This is my home parish now & for a number of years, but I'm reviewing it not so much as a review but as a method of sharing an exquisitely beautiful cathedral. Open daily, I attend Mass here on weekdays when I may (@ 12:05) and am a regular at the 5 o'clock on Sunday where the music will absolutely...

If you enjoy visiting various houses of worship as we do, then I would say that this church deserves your attention. Although it is not the most ornate church that we have come across it is both pleasing to the eye and soul.

We had talked to a local couple that were eating at the Olde Dublin Pub, who were going to a wedding. As we walked by St. Dunstan's Basilica, we saw them come out.With a wedding going on we did not go inside. This was the Jubilee Year of Mercy and St. Dunstan's Basilica had the Holy Door.

Having visted Gastonbury in England last year I was fascinated to find such a magnificent cathedral honouring this modest monk who rose to become the Arch Bishop of Canterbury...one of a long line canonized by the Roman Catholic Church. Today we think of Canterbury more in terms of the Anglican Communion making this place even more interesting. The building itself...
Went to Sunday mass, bonus was the great architecture in well kept parish and pipe organ played well with soloist

Lovely Basilica and not busy when we visited. Some very interesting stain glass windows - some traditional, but some more modern styles which almost seemed out of place. Free entry, but obviously donations are welcome.

This is a very beauty church...if you are in Charlottetown it is a must see! The inside of St. Dunstan's Basilica is spectacular. The stain glass windows are breath taking. Enjoy your visit, you will not be disappointed.
This cathedral is beautiful and worth a visit. It is good to see an important religious structure being maintained. You can feel the presence of God.
It is a lovely basilica. Very inviting for people come inside and look around. Very worth your time to look into.

Definitely a must to visit. The basilica is beautiful, I wish we would have been able to attend mass there. There is a neat display with a small boat used by a former bishop to travel to different communities. There is an impressive pipe organ that I imagine sounds awesome. Next time we will make sure to attend mass there.

Although this is beautiful church with an incredible organ, I didn't find it particularly interesting. The stained glass windows had modern looking individuals portrayed in them. The candles to light for others were the most expensive I've ever seen at any other catholic church.
The spires dominate the skyscape and the inside is just as amazing. The stained glass windows are modern scenes and compare easily to some of the best in Europe. A must see in Charlottetown!

It's like stepping into history! Beautiful sculptures and paintings, the organ just envelopes the whole congression. Only downfall is that some tourists don't respect the signs when there is a private function, and just wonder through anyway.we were there for a wedding and tourists came right in and took pictures of the alter as we were waiting for the wedding...

We hadn't plan on visiting the basilica on our trip to PEI but when we saw the outside of the church during our walk in old Charlottetown we decided to drop in and were not disappointed, just a spectacular church with great murals and stain glass windows.
Over the years, we have seen many churches and each one is unique... do go inside and enjoy this one. It is not far from the port. Lots of other interesting buildings along Rue Great George ...
Built in the early 1900's, this church is worth the visit. It is open daily until 5PM so be sure you add this to your list of places to visit in Charlottetown.
Take a nice long walk around the building, it is lovely to look at, easy to find. Then, take time to have a peaceful moment to be thankful. A nice addition to day visit to lovely town.
If you are into churches or architecture it is worth seeing. There is a parking lot close by and a pub just up the street so it's easy to make it a walk by stop when you are downtown.

This is a beautiful place to visit, light a candle for a loved one who has passed, meditate. We love to visit cathedrals and were very happy to stumble across this one as we walked around Charlottetown.

We were out walking before 8:00 am and the Basilica was open. Amazing workmanship inside and on the exterior of the church. I didn't see any literature on the inside of the church and did not see anyone to ask questions. When we continued on down the street a company was removing old cast bells from the basement area of...
Oh the beauty of this Church. You just can't drive by. Goose bumps when entering. Was very busy with so many tourists. It is just so amazing!!
A gothic church that has far more to offer on the outside than on the inside. It is truly lovely from afar. I likrd the stain glass window over the altar but not the modern ones on the windows

This is an historic site in downtown Charlottetown. The visual effects are most enjoyed from outside. Had a chance to take a look inside but mass was starting so we did not venture too far. This is not an ostentatiously decorated church.
I would recommend at the very least a drive by of this unique cathedral; if you drive by you can be sure you will want to stop and snap a couple pics. Great tourist spot.
I LOVE visiting beautiful old churches wherever I go and St. Dunstans is always worth a visit. A truly exquisite building.

St Dunstan's in in downtown Charlottetown. It is near Victoria Row and many downtown restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues. Parking is easy. The Basilica is very pretty and definitely worth a few minutes to step inside and appreciate its beauty.
Closed until noon. It's all about the power the church possessed over these migrants. Very grand. The stain glass windows are a bit eerie
It's close to the waterfront and an easy walk. It's a beautiful church and worth a visit if you are doing a walking tour...which you should when in town.

We arrived in Charlottetown on a Sunday afternoon after driving all morning from Halifax and were happy to find out that there was a 5:00 pm mass that we were able to attend. The basilica is sublimely beautiful inside and out. It is well worth visiting and learning about its history from brochures found inside the entry.
Charlottetown is an adorable easy walking town. A must see is the St. Dunstan's Basilica. Just stunning inside and out.
Stopped while on a stroll through Charlottetown. Found it peaceful and gave us time to reflect. The doors to the church are open to every denomination.

This is an oassis in Charlottetown a short walk from the waterfront. To reflect and "just be" among the beauty and serenity is exactly what this traveller needed. The windows and the ambience of the building provided a needed respite in order to spend some time to rest and reflect on our faith. A beautiful edifice.

The tallest building in Charlottetown this is a stand-out Church with a gorgeous interior. Mostly marble with an interesting color palette and with bright, beautiful stained glass windows, it is a very pleasant place to visit after a long walk about the downtown area.

We were able to visit St. Dunstan's Basilica in Charlottetown on a rainy Sunday. It is located downtown within walking distance of the Confederation Centre of the Arts and Victoria Row. The steeples, stained glass, statues, the altar, organ pipes and the ceiling of this building is just beautiful.

If you enjoy seeing the wonderful works of art this is a must see. The building is beautifully presented with lots of marble. It is a piece of art and history. Only issue is check the hours that it is open. Don't want to be disappointed.

Large beautiful Basilica in the center of town which is easy walking distance from the docks. Stain glass is beautiful. 1919 was the fourth time that is was rebuilt. It is free and worth the stop to see.
large & magnificent. It's steeples can be seen from the entire city.It's alter, sculptures, pipe organ etc are all beautiful.
This is located just a short walk from the confederation building. It is very nice inside. Go see it.
A beautiful Basilica in downtown Charlottetown. Well worth a visit.Beautiful stained glass, marble, alter , organ. Large balcony.

Lovely early 20th-century basilica. Kept in top condition, with very historical architecture, lots of beautiful stained glass and large vaulted ceilings. Highly recommended if you happen to be in Charlottetown.
I was quite taken back when I entered this basilica. It was stunning. I felt like I was in a small European town instead of P.E.I. This should not be missed , even if you are not religious.
Walked around the city on our own. Beautiful church. Well preserved. Well suited to the environment around it. Lovely architecture.
A "must see" for PEI. If you visit the Province House and Great George you cannot miss the Basilica.

The historic architectural design,the marble pillars, stained glass windows and statues are remarkable. This church is wheel chair accessible if you have a travel companion that can access the caretaker inside they will accommodate you with an elevator access.
What a lovely way to end our great vacation, a visit to this beautiful church. Walk around look at the wonderful works of art. Then sit and reflect on peace and beauty of this wonderful old church.
This is an absolutely beautiful church. You must stop here and view it even it you're not religious. It's worth the stop. Stained glass windows and artistry everywhere you look.

As soon as we entered the basilica it was apparent why this was one of the top attractions in Charlottetown. The stained glass, pipe organ and architecture was what I was most impressed with along with the cart/boat the bishop used during his missions. It was easy to park on a Monday morning of the long weekend and we were...

Wish I had timed this to grab a tour. I believe on one of the walking tours this is also covered. The basilica is certainly lovely in Charlottetown. A short walk from here brings you to the main street where there are tons of shops and restaurants. English Gothic and inspired by St. Patrick's in NYC. This 4th cathedral was...
The granddaughters were very interested with the interior of the Basilica. The carved wooden statues by the alter were very intricate.
St. Dunstan's is a glorious building, with freshly cleaned stone exterior and beautiful interior. I always enjoy visiting it.
There was a wedding finishing up on the front steps when we arrived but the church was open and we were glad we made the walk across town to visit.

Having traveled in Europe and visited many churches, I have seen some very spectacular ones. At. Dunstan's, although definitely not the most impressive is very lovely. There has been some water damage to the inside but work has been completed on the outside to prevent further damage and restoration has begun inside. Nice place to spend some quiet time even...

Just to see this majestic old Basilica is worth the visit. What a wonderful example of High Victorian Gothic Revival style of architecture. Take the time to see the entire church not just the main floor if at all possible. It is a beautiful building.

If you visit the island, you might enjoy stopping by and checking out the basilica. The building has some interesting history, as provided by The Great George Customer Service Manager. Definitely check out some details on this building.

My husband and I have visited many churches and this is one of the best we've ever seen. Even if you're not at all religious, go see the architecture and detail of this amazing building. I was completely in awe.

Did a walking tour of the area and came across this wonderful church. It was in the evening and it was closed (5pm closed) so we went back the next morning for a prayer and candle lighting. Totally spiritual experience. Beautiful interior. Highly recommend to drop and and enjoy the atmosphere

What a beautiful part of our vacation. We not only had the pleasure of seeing the inside of this church but we attended Mass on Sunday evening at 5 o'clock. Absolutely one of the highlights of our trip. The choir was amazing singing Alleluia. If we ever come back to Charlottetown we will definitely be including St dunstan's basilica as...

The craftsmanship that went into the design of this church is amazing.I had not planned to go into the church and when I did I was amazed at the art.Wood work to windows - Amazing. I went back with friends to have them see the craftsmanship.
The St Dunstan's Basilica is well worth the time to stop and explore! It is stunning inside and out!
We were pleasantly surprised to enter the church and find a man playing the organ. It made our tour of the building that much more delightful.

The interior is very much like the larger cathedrals of Europe, only smaller and cuter. Probably a great place for those of this faith to spend a Sunday morning service, should they happen to find themselves there on a weekend. The exterior makes the building look larger than it is, with it's gothic spires and bell tower.

Right in the heart of Charlottetown, PEI. If you like to .ook at cathedrals, this one is worth the visit. I have seen some of the famous ones in Europe, but when I walked into St. Dunstan's, I still said wow.
When we travel we always make a point to visit a church and the St Dunstans Basilica was exceptional. beautiful history and charming architecture
This is a impressive basilica on this tiny island dating back t the 1700's. The stonework is amazing. This is quite large for such a small island. Very welcoming.

You can see the steeples of this church from all over Charlottetown. It is a great landmark. You should go in it to observe the beautiful interior. We love old churches and this one did not disappoint us.
Take the time to stop into this beautiful Basilica. It's tremendously impressive. The very long Aisle down to the altar and vaulted ceiling give you a sense of soaring space.

The St. Dunstan's Basillica is located in downtown Charlottetown. The outside is very well maintained and the inside is breathtaking. One of the nicest churches I've visited in Atlantic Canada - would definitley recommend checking it out if you're in Charlottetown!
We visited the Basilica just in time for the 5:00 mass. The interiors were stunning and the pastor was both funny and great in his sermon. Would visit again.

We visited St. Dunstan's when we staying across the street at the Great George hotel. The stained glass is worth taking the time to visit during the day; unlike many churches, the glass has a modern turn of pattern and colour that is quite unique and attractive.The architecture of the church is also beautiful.We were fortunate to be...

Stain glass despiict the holy sacraments. Not too much and not too little. A beautiful church with an interesting history. Situatuated within walking distance of other places of interest in Charlottetown
Quite and edifice in a small city. Well worth taking a few minutes to poke your headed inside and take in the wonderful interior of this churc.
We visited this church while in Charlottetown the location is right close to federation center free parking on the road. It's nice place to visit.
A short visit to St. Dunstan is recommended for busy travelers, like myself, to find some quiet time and respite.
I always visit this place to the Island. It is breathtaking and so peaceful inside, like God himself is in there with you.
?Small compared to other basilicas in Europe but towers over the relatively modest Charlottetown skyline. Nice interior and exterior architecture.

This is a beautiful church and we sat enjoying the details while resting inside the cool interior of the church. It was the perfect stop between the downtown area and the wharf. Lots of history in the area. Both the church and the building next door are worth viewing.
We walked in for the last 15 minutes of an organ recital, which was of course lovely. Nothing shows off a cathedral as well as organ music.

Was amazing as the building had very detailed pieces to it. Such a beautiful grand building. We visited the church on a Sunday while service was still going on so we did not see much of the inside but the outside is stunning!
You don't have to be a religious fanatic to enjoy the beauty and the peace you feel when you enter St Dunstan's ! Just take your time and soak it all in !
Well with a visit! Beautiful church on a very historic street. I really enjoyed my visit and thought that it was a very large building in a pretty small city.

We had no idea what we were in for when we wandered into St. Dunstan's Basilica. The interior is stunning - elegant and grand. The stained glass windows and high ceilings are awe-inspiring. We didn't need a tour, simply wandered respectfully around the space. Located downtown, the basilica is an easy stop, and is well worth the time of a...

This is large, beautiful church that is free to visit. Take time to look at the stained glass and side altars. Steps from the main street so stop inside. Very peaceful and well-maintained. Historical significance as well.
What a beautifful chuch. There is a lot of masterpiece to discover in this one. There is a lot of detail in all windows and sculpture.

This church is a huge landmark in this small town. The stained glass windows are outstanding. The inside is very elaborate. They have a small altar on one side with an interesting dory story. A lovely spot to visit!
It was a pleasure to view your church and to take the time to explore all of the architectural details.A must see!
I do not go to church but am spiritual. I got married in this church. If I need to feel close to a higher power this is where it would be. So much history and beauty.

For Catholics, a visit to St. Dunstan's Basilica would be special. It is a Jubilee Church with a Holy Door. Both exterior and interior were impressive, meant to inspire prayer, as Gothic architecture aims to do. It is also a designated National Historical Site in Canada, a cause for historical conservation.

Stopped here along our tour of Charlottetwon. When you understand the churches history it has more meaning. The original location was across the street and the wooden church burned down. Good thing the stained glass was not in place when the last burn occurred, it would have been lost. Stands out easily in the city so you can get your...

After a fire that destroyed the first stone cathedral in Charlottetown early in the 20th century, the Charlottetown diocese raised a true French Gothic Cathedral that towers above the city skyline. From its many stained glass windows, commemorating those who served the church over more than a century, to a stunning German Rose Window and a panoply of 23 statues...

A beautiful in the heart of downtown Charlottetown. Spires are visible from various parts of the city and add to the cityscape.Beautiful marble, stained glass and statues. A very peaceful place.This is a special place to me and I never tire of its beauty.There is a lot of history here and if you visit in the summer...
Beautiful center of worship for Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island. History well documented throughout building & pamphlets available.
Unbelievable !! The statues and stained glass is gorgeous !! Friendly people talking about the history. Go and see you wont be disappointed.

This is a stunning sight in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island. I stopped here on a cruise of Eastern Canada. You can see the three spires of the basilica from the harbor. I had to see the church. I was able to walk here from the harbor. The church is open to the public, as long as you remain respectful. Since...
What makes this cathedral unusual are the twin spires. Very ornate inside. A must see in the centre of the city and a quiet spot to get away from the crowds and meditate.
Amazing architecture. The church is in excellent condition and has a wonderfully peaceful quality. The stone carving is excellent as well.
One of the most beautiful, enchanting places I've ever seen. Stunning architecture. I am not religious in the slightest but was taken by the beauty of this church. Pictures do not do justice.

Visited this beautiful, old, Church while on vacation on the Island. Very impressive. Amazing architectural features inside and the Stained Glass Windows were lovely. Well worth a visit. So nice you can pinpoint this building by the 3 Steeples almost anywhere in the downtown area.

If you enjoy visiting churches... This isn't unique one in Charlottetown. The church is located on a very historic street in Charlottetown.. Enjoy the stroll and visiting inside. Occasionally there are concerns at noon... Good luck toCatching one.

Stopped by to have look. Very detailed and beautiful. Reminded us of Europe. If you are interested in buildings, churches or just beauty, you should definitely stop by! Does not have to be time consuming and it was open for people to walk around when we went.

A beautiful, restored Basilica.A one of a kind church, home to the many Catholic families of the island.Beautiful architecture inside and out. Stained-glass windows depicting the religious passages in one's life are truly beautiful.Well worth a visit.
Lovely. Take time to attend the Sunday service. Very moving. Make not of the boat/sleigh used by the first Bishop. It is smaller than expected, so look carefully.
The Statuary is very impressive. The stained glass is average. The interior is beautifully detailed and well preserved.
very decorative. took lots of photos. recommend visiting this cathedral built in early 1900's. within walking distance of tourist area
You really shoul check this out. the organ is huge. There is some reallly pretty stained glass.It is beautiful!!
This is a most magnificent church! From the moment you walk in you are surrounded by beautiful marble, woodwork and plaster work. This is one sight I would not miss if I was visiting the area.

What a beautiful building! We visited at a time when the cathedral was closed, so missed seeing the interior. The only downfall was the high number of panhandlers in the area. We're always happy to help those in need, but there seems to a really high concentration here.
This has to be the most beautiful church I have ever seen.the woodwork and plaster work is breathtaking. A feeling of peace washes over you the minute you walk in.

We totally enjoyed walking through this beautiful basilica. The windows and the stations of the cross were works of art. The extremely colorful candles were actual, real candles! ( in the states, most candles in churches have been replaced with electric flames - not nearly as beautiful)
This is a must for all of Catholic faith to attend. The Massive Pipe Organ combined with an Angelic singer created a magical atmosphere. The character of this Church jumps out at you from everywhere.

A must see if you are in downtown Charlottetown. It's open to the public and you can go inside and it just takes your breath away. The stained glass windows, the arched ceiling with the intricate details on it and everything else inside is stunningly beautiful. One of the prettiest churches I have ever been in.

Superb architecture, cathedral with stained glass windows and statues of the apostles and various saints. We attended mass without the choir but the music from the pipe organ and the piano was uplifting. A very beautiful piece of history in the centre of Charlottetown.
Wonderful Basilica. Located in downtown Charlottetown PEI. Attended Saturday evening Mass. Inspiring and in English

It is a beautiful structure - gorgeous stained glass windows & statues. It's vaulted ceiling gives a cavernous feel. Although a believer but not a church goer I felt calm, relaxed & reflective. I would recommend a visit.
we went to the 5pm Saturday evening mass. The music and singing was very good. I believe the mass was even said by a cardinal. The church was very nice
This church is a must see if you visit Charlottetown. Beautiful stain glass windows, huge ceilings & a very calm feeling. The sound of a choir in there will give you goose bumps

Attending Mass at St. Dunstan' Basilica was truly an uplifting experience. The choir, making their last appearance before their summer holiday, was in fine voice. The congregation was very friendly, and the homily was very thought-provoking.
This church is worth going to see. The architecture inside and out was a marvel and you can appreciate all that went into this building.
Peaceful location with the spires rising above the trees - what a lovely place. The basilica is large but welcoming. Be sure to visit when in Charlottetown.
A quick stop is worth it. Very peaceful and beautiful cathedral. It is an easy walk from anywhere down town with many other stops along the way.
Must try and find, the architecture is spectacular and you can see the spires from most of town. Beautiful way to start our trip, almost like being in France.
A must see place when visiting Charlottetown, great architecture and a good place to pray. The Sunday mass was in progress during my visit, and the choir was amazing.

If you happen to see twin spires in Charlottetown, then you've located St. Dunstan's. It's a beautiful French Gothic cathedral and worth visiting for Mass or just a few moments of peace and quiet during a busy holiday.

This gorgeous basilica was the perfect place to begin our holiday on PEI. We attended Sunday mass and were greeted outside by the pastor who provided a warm welcome and chatted with us about trip.The organ music and choir filled the basilica with amazing sound.Treat yourself not only to a tour but also mass for the best possible...
Love the church so much, we got married in it. Amazing structure and beauty inside. Climb the tower if it is open.
Amazing church and you can also go inside which is just gorgeous as well and the history behind this.
The detail, the size, the location... it's a beautiful cathedral and open to the public. Worth stopping in.
Worth the stop. The stained glass windows are beautiful and the architecture is impressive. Open to the public. Worth a look!
Such a beautiful place that words cannot really describe it fully.Even if you are not a religious person you will be awed by the sheer majesty of St. Dunstan's.

Beautiful old Cathedral that offers free (donation only) concerts (often organ) during the summer months. Last year during our summer vacation we were thrilled to see a young talented tenor by the name of Geordie Brown perform a very entertaining concert. Whether you go for a mass, a tour or a concert, St Dunstan's is a great place to visit.
What a incredibly beautiful church to see. Stained glass windows and painted ceiling. A must see. It really did remind me of grand old churches I've only seen in pictures.
This Basilica looks impressive from the outside but even more so on the inside. Take some time to admire the architecture - rivals many churches in Europe. A gem in the Atlantic Region.
I was visiting and had the opportunity to sit and listen while the pipe organ played. Wonderful thank yo
Well worth the visit this beautiful Basilica was such a site to behold it was so majestic it took our breath away its a great way to say welcome to charlottetown!
Stayed for mass, and the priest allowed us to take photos. Amazing place, thankfully my husband is familiar with the history and gave me lots of information!

This is a magnificient building with a fascinating history. You need some time to take it all in and then to sit and reflect. Although this building is old compared to the others in this city, it is actually a replacement of the original folllowing a fire. The building surrounding it are worth seeing as well. Great to be there...

This is a gorgeous building and the most imposing structure in Charlottetown's skyline. You can see its towers from almost anywhere in town. The interior is well preserved and maintained. Sadly,the basilica in Halifax has been turned into a dump but PEI takes wonderful pride in this amazing building.
old style catholic church with wooden pews marble floor glorious stained glass reflections traditionally our Bishops church it is a must see

This church is so rich in history plus where many people have been healed by faith since it was built still today. It a must visit without a rushed scheduled where you can pray or just sit in awe and admire it's beautiful construction and artwork within the wall of the building inside and out.
great great view in NY. high up makes me woozy. better get me a bucket. you should go there and have some fun!

A beautiful old style church in the most historic neighbourhood of Charlottetown. A fantastic part of any walking tour of the Cradle of Confederation. Active parish with several weekend Masses and an Adoration Chapel.
Very famous for the weddings that take place and the scenic views of downtown Old Charlottetown ....bring your camera.

Structure was started in 1913 and work continued until 1919. The steeples of St Dunstan's Basilica tower above mostly all other buildings in Charlottetown. Interior is grand with high ceilings and Italian marble. Certainly a must see place for those interested in old architecture.
A great place to stop and visit.. Lots of beautiful old buildings on PEI and this is one not to miss.
We got married in this church so I am Biased, but it is beautiful and worth the visit. The paintings on the ceiling and a trip up the tower are a must see.
Only saw the church from the outside, but it is definitely worth the detour if you are visiting Charlottetown. The architecture is beautiful ! Not too crowded.
I have been in this Church many times. It is absolutely beautiful inside. I love all the cherubs up in the corners and ceiling.
Very nice basilica with gothic spire architecture.If you're in Charlottetown, it's worth checking out.
Visited this Catholic Church twice in last 6 years and is very beautiful inside.Its location is only 2 blocks from the waterfront.A MUST SEE if you are visiting Charlottetown.
This is one of the most churches that I have ever stepped foot in. The architecture is unbelievable. The stained glass and the huge pipe organ are so beautiful.

The Church was built in 1896 of Wallace stone which gives it a soft brown color. The interior is English Gothic and reminiscent of some of the great cathedrals of Europe. The stained glass windows and magnificent organ are worth seeing. The Basilica has been designated a National Historic Site of Canada.

Make sure to pop inside for a look if you're passing by. This beautiful church sits right in the middle of downtown Charlottetown and really stands out. The architecture is breathtaking and though the whole island is filled with churches, this one is a step above the rest!
Lots of young folks with teeny babies attend Sunday church here. The priest/pastor was charming. The cathedral is just lovely.
This looks like a really old cathedral but actually isn't. The stained glass is worth a visit, but be sure to look up at the huge organ.

St. Dunstan's Basilica is a beautiful structure, modeled after St. Patrick's Cathedral in NYC. It is actually the 4th cathedral on this site, completed in 1919, after the first stone structure was burned in 1913. it has double spires covered in copper that are visible from around the city. Many of the stained glass windows honor the basilica's past bishops...

St. Dunstan's is beautiful enough to rival many of the great cathedrals in Europe. The architecture, stained glass and altar sculptures are definitely worth seeing.Many of the stained glass windows are donated and pay homage to the priests and bishops who have served the church over the years.

While taking a walk about Charlottetown recently, we came across this magnificent structure, the twin spires of which can be seen from most parts of the city. This Basilica has a great history and features a beautiful architectural interior with lovely stained glass windows and a wonderful pipe organ. It’s also a beautiful spot to sit quietly and reflect. I...
This beautiful basilica rises above the gorgeous old trees on this quiet, quaint George St.The interior of this cathedral is truly spiritual.
Worth a visit, both for its beauty and for its peaceful environment. The high altar is amazing, like a mini cathedral, and the stained glass is lovely as well. The history is interesting as well.

We stopped here while on a private tour w/Take the Island Adventure Tours. As seen from the picture, the church is built of beautiful old sandstone. What I found intriguing was the stained glass windows. Many of which were dedicated to past priests and were made of hand painted faces on glass. Very unusual , in my opinion.
beautiful workmanship , definitely worth a visit , in the downtown area, a very holy and beautiful sight.
Very nice with a holy atmosphere. Worth a visit and it's right there in downtown. Check opening hours as they take a break in the middle of the day.
It was wonderful to see such beauty & workmanship. Still a functioning cathedral with regular services.
Great old traditional church granted Basilica status by the Vatican. Friendly and helpful church member available to answer questions. Easy to get to and well worth 30 minutes, By donation
Lovely church. Wonderful architecture. Beautiful stained glass and wood carvings at the alter. There are candles that you can light alson
Beautiful basilica. Fantastic architecture. Amazing a town this small can have a basilica so big. A must see for Charlottetown. Entry by donation during most hours of the day.
